SPEECH.SPEAKER: LUCIANUS
SPEECH.LINE: Thoughts black, hands apt, drugs fit, and time agreeing;
Confederate season, else no creature seeing;
Thou mixture rank, of midnight weeds collected,
With Hecate's ban thrice blasted, thrice infected,
Thy natural magic and dire property,
On wholesome life usurp immediately.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Pours the poison into the sleeper's ears

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: He poisons him i' the garden for's estate. His
name's Gonzago: the story is extant, and writ in
choice Italian: you shall see anon how the murderer
gets the love of Gonzago's wife.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: The king rises.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: What, frighted with false fire!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: How fares my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Give o'er the play.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Give me some light: away!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Lights, lights, lights!

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt all but HAMLET and HORATIO

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, let the stricken deer go weep,
The hart ungalled play;
For some must watch, while some must sleep:
So runs the world away.
Would not this, sir, and a forest of feathers-- if
the rest of my fortunes turn Turk with me--with two
Provincial roses on my razed shoes, get me a
fellowship in a cry of players, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Half a share.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: A whole one, I.
For thou dost know, O Damon dear,
This realm dismantled was
Of Jove himself; and now reigns here
A very, very--pajock.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: You might have rhymed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: O good Horatio, I'll take the ghost's word for a
thousand pound. Didst perceive?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Very well, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Upon the talk of the poisoning?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: I did very well note him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ah, ha! Come, some music! come, the recorders!
For if the king like not the comedy,
Why then, belike, he likes it not, perdy.
Come, some music!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: Good my lord, vouchsafe me a word with you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, a whole history.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: The king, sir,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, sir, what of him?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: Is in his retirement marvellous distempered.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: With drink, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: No, my lord, rather with choler.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Your wisdom should show itself more richer to
signify this to his doctor; for, for me to put him
to his purgation would perhaps plunge him into far
more choler.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: Good my lord, put your discourse into some frame and
start not so wildly from my affair.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I am tame, sir: pronounce.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: The queen, your mother, in most great affliction of
spirit, hath sent me to you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: You are welcome.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, good my lord, this courtesy is not of the right
breed. If it shall please you to make me a
wholesome answer, I will do your mother's
commandment: if not, your pardon and my return
shall be the end of my business.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I cannot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: What, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Make you a wholesome answer; my wit's diseased: but,
sir, such answer as I can make, you shall command;
or, rather, as you say, my mother: therefore no
more, but to the matter: my mother, you say,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Then thus she says; your behavior hath struck her
into amazement and admiration.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: O wonderful son, that can so astonish a mother! But
is there no sequel at the heels of this mother's
admiration? Impart.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: She desires to speak with you in her closet, ere you
go to bed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: We shall obey, were she ten times our mother. Have
you any further trade with us?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, you once did love me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: So I do still, by these pickers and stealers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Good my lord, what is your cause of distemper? you
do, surely, bar the door upon your own liberty, if
you deny your griefs to your friend.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, I lack advancement.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: How can that be, when you have the voice of the king
himself for your succession in Denmark?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, but sir, 'While the grass grows,'--the proverb
is something musty.
O, the recorders! let me see one. To withdraw with
you:--why do you go about to recover the wind of me,
as if you would drive me into a toil?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: O, my lord, if my duty be too bold, my love is too
unmannerly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I do not well understand that. Will you play upon
this pipe?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, I cannot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: Believe me, I cannot.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I do beseech you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: I know no touch of it, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis as easy as lying: govern these ventages with
your lingers and thumb, give it breath with your
mouth, and it will discourse most eloquent music.
Look you, these are the stops.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: But these cannot I command to any utterance of
harmony; I have not the skill.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, look you now, how unworthy a thing you make of
me! You would play upon me; you would seem to know
my stops; you would pluck out the heart of my
mystery; you would sound me from my lowest note to
the top of my compass: and there is much music,
excellent voice, in this little organ; yet cannot
you make it speak. 'Sblood, do you think I am
easier to be played on than a pipe? Call me what
instrument you will, though you can fret me, yet you
cannot play upon me.
God bless you, sir!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, the queen would speak with you, and
presently.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Do you see yonder cloud that's almost in shape of a camel?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: By the mass, and 'tis like a camel, indeed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Methinks it is like a weasel.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: It is backed like a weasel.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Or like a whale?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Very like a whale.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Then I will come to my mother by and by. They fool
me to the top of my bent. I will come by and by.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I will say so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: By and by is easily said.
Leave me, friends.
Tis now the very witching time of night,
When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out
Contagion to this world: now could I drink hot blood,
And do such bitter business as the day
Would quake to look on. Soft! now to my mother.
O heart, lose not thy nature; let not ever
The soul of Nero enter this firm bosom:
Let me be cruel, not unnatural:
I will speak daggers to her, but use none;
My tongue and soul in this be hypocrites;
How in my words soever she be shent,
To give them seals never, my soul, consent!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I like him not, nor stands it safe with us
To let his madness range. Therefore prepare you;
I your commission will forthwith dispatch,
And he to England shall along with you:
The terms of our estate may not endure
Hazard so dangerous as doth hourly grow
Out of his lunacies.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: We will ourselves provide:
Most holy and religious fear it is
To keep those many many bodies safe
That live and feed upon your majesty.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: The single and peculiar life is bound,
With all the strength and armour of the mind,
To keep itself from noyance; but much more
That spirit upon whose weal depend and rest
The lives of many. The cease of majesty
Dies not alone; but, like a gulf, doth draw
What's near it with it: it is a massy wheel,
Fix'd on the summit of the highest mount,
To whose huge spokes ten thousand lesser things
Are mortised and adjoin'd; which, when it falls,
Each small annexment, petty consequence,
Attends the boisterous ruin. Never alone
Did the king sigh, but with a general groan.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Arm you, I pray you, to this speedy voyage;
For we will fetters put upon this fear,
Which now goes too free-footed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: We will haste us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, he's going to his mother's closet:
Behind the arras I'll convey myself,
To hear the process; and warrant she'll tax him home:
And, as you said, and wisely was it said,
'Tis meet that some more audience than a mother,
Since nature makes them partial, should o'erhear
The speech, of vantage. Fare you well, my liege:
I'll call upon you ere you go to bed,
And tell you what I know.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Thanks, dear my lord.
O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven;
It hath the primal eldest curse upon't,
A brother's murder. Pray can I not,
Though inclination be as sharp as will:
My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent;
And, like a man to double business bound,
I stand in pause where I shall first begin,
And both neglect. What if this cursed hand
Were thicker than itself with brother's blood,
Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens
To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy
But to confront the visage of offence?
And what's in prayer but this two-fold force,
To be forestalled ere we come to fall,
Or pardon'd being down? Then I'll look up;
My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer
Can serve my turn? 'Forgive me my foul murder'?
That cannot be; since I am still possess'd
Of those effects for which I did the murder,
My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.
May one be pardon'd and retain the offence?
In the corrupted currents of this world
Offence's gilded hand may shove by justice,
And oft 'tis seen the wicked prize itself
Buys out the law: but 'tis not so above;
There is no shuffling, there the action lies
In his true nature; and we ourselves compell'd,
Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,
To give in evidence. What then? what rests?
Try what repentance can: what can it not?
Yet what can it when one can not repent?
O wretched state! O bosom black as death!
O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,
Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!
Bow, stubborn knees; and, heart with strings of steel,
Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!
All may be well.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Now might I do it pat, now he is praying;
And now I'll do't. And so he goes to heaven;
And so am I revenged. That would be scann'd:
A villain kills my father; and for that,
I, his sole son, do this same villain send
To heaven.
O, this is hire and salary, not revenge.
He took my father grossly, full of bread;
With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May;
And how his audit stands who knows save heaven?
But in our circumstance and course of thought,
'Tis heavy with him: and am I then revenged,
To take him in the purging of his soul,
When he is fit and season'd for his passage?
No!
Up, sword; and know thou a more horrid hent:
When he is drunk asleep, or in his rage,
Or in the incestuous pleasure of his bed;
At gaming, swearing, or about some act
That has no relish of salvation in't;
Then trip him, that his heels may kick at heaven,
And that his soul may be as damn'd and black
As hell, whereto it goes. My mother stays:
This physic but prolongs thy sickly days.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Rising My words fly up, my thoughts remain below:
Words without thoughts never to heaven go.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. The Queen's closet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: He will come straight. Look you lay home to him:
Tell him his pranks have been too broad to bear with,
And that your grace hath screen'd and stood between
Much heat and him. I'll sconce me even here.
Pray you, be round with him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Within Mother, mother, mother!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: I'll warrant you,
Fear me not: withdraw, I hear him coming.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Now, mother, what's the matter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Hamlet, thou hast thy father much offended.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Mother, you have my father much offended.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Come, come, you answer with an idle tongue.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Go, go, you question with a wicked tongue.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Why, how now, Hamlet!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: What's the matter now?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Have you forgot me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: No, by the rood, not so:
You are the queen, your husband's brother's wife;
And--would it were not so!--you are my mother.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, then, I'll set those to you that can speak.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Come, come, and sit you down; you shall not budge;
You go not till I set you up a glass
Where you may see the inmost part of you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: What wilt thou do? thou wilt not murder me?
Help, help, ho!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Behind What, ho! help, help, help!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Drawing How now! a rat? Dead, for a ducat, dead!

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Makes a pass through the arras

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LORD POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Behind O, I am slain!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: O me, what hast thou done?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I know not:
Is it the king?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: O, what a rash and bloody deed is this!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: A bloody deed! almost as bad, good mother,
As kill a king, and marry with his brother.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: As kill a king!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, lady, 'twas my word.
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Lifts up the array and discovers POLONIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Thou wretched, rash, intruding fool, farewell!
I took thee for thy better: take thy fortune;
Thou find'st to be too busy is some danger.
Leave wringing of your hands: peace! sit you down,
And let me wring your heart; for so I shall,
If it be made of penetrable stuff,
If damned custom have not brass'd it so
That it is proof and bulwark against sense.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: What have I done, that thou darest wag thy tongue
In noise so rude against me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Such an act
That blurs the grace and blush of modesty,
Calls virtue hypocrite, takes off the rose
From the fair forehead of an innocent love
And sets a blister there, makes marriage-vows
As false as dicers' oaths: O, such a deed
As from the body of contraction plucks
The very soul, and sweet religion makes
A rhapsody of words: heaven's face doth glow:
Yea, this solidity and compound mass,
With tristful visage, as against the doom,
Is thought-sick at the act.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Ay me, what act,
That roars so loud, and thunders in the index?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Look here, upon this picture, and on this,
The counterfeit presentment of two brothers.
See, what a grace was seated on this brow;
Hyperion's curls; the front of Jove himself;
An eye like Mars, to threaten and command;
A station like the herald Mercury
New-lighted on a heaven-kissing hill;
A combination and a form indeed,
Where every god did seem to set his seal,
To give the world assurance of a man:
This was your husband. Look you now, what follows:
Here is your husband; like a mildew'd ear,
Blasting his wholesome brother. Have you eyes?
Could you on this fair mountain leave to feed,
And batten on this moor? Ha! have you eyes?
You cannot call it love; for at your age
The hey-day in the blood is tame, it's humble,
And waits upon the judgment: and what judgment
Would step from this to this? Sense, sure, you have,
Else could you not have motion; but sure, that sense
Is apoplex'd; for madness would not err,
Nor sense to ecstasy was ne'er so thrall'd
But it reserved some quantity of choice,
To serve in such a difference. What devil was't
That thus hath cozen'd you at hoodman-blind?
Eyes without feeling, feeling without sight,
Ears without hands or eyes, smelling sans all,
Or but a sickly part of one true sense
Could not so mope.
O shame! where is thy blush? Rebellious hell,
If thou canst mutine in a matron's bones,
To flaming youth let virtue be as wax,
And melt in her own fire: proclaim no shame
When the compulsive ardour gives the charge,
Since frost itself as actively doth burn
And reason panders will.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: O Hamlet, speak no more:
Thou turn'st mine eyes into my very soul;
And there I see such black and grained spots
As will not leave their tinct.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but to live
In the rank sweat of an enseamed bed,
Stew'd in corruption, honeying and making love
Over the nasty sty,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: O, speak to me no more;
These words, like daggers, enter in mine ears;
No more, sweet Hamlet!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: A murderer and a villain;
A slave that is not twentieth part the tithe
Of your precedent lord; a vice of kings;
A cutpurse of the empire and the rule,
That from a shelf the precious diadem stole,
And put it in his pocket!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: No more!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: A king of shreds and patches,--
Save me, and hover o'er me with your wings,
You heavenly guards! What would your gracious figure?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, he's mad!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Do you not come your tardy son to chide,
That, lapsed in time and passion, lets go by
The important acting of your dread command? O, say!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Ghost
SPEECH.LINE: Do not forget: this visitation
Is but to whet thy almost blunted purpose.
But, look, amazement on thy mother sits:
O, step between her and her fighting soul:
Conceit in weakest bodies strongest works:
Speak to her, Hamlet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How is it with you, lady?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, how is't with you,
That you do bend your eye on vacancy
And with the incorporal air do hold discourse?
Forth at your eyes your spirits wildly peep;
And, as the sleeping soldiers in the alarm,
Your bedded hair, like life in excrements,
Starts up, and stands on end. O gentle son,
Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper
Sprinkle cool patience. Whereon do you look?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: On him, on him! Look you, how pale he glares!
His form and cause conjoin'd, preaching to stones,
Would make them capable. Do not look upon me;
Lest with this piteous action you convert
My stern effects: then what I have to do
Will want true colour; tears perchance for blood.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: To whom do you speak this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Do you see nothing there?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Nothing at all; yet all that is I see.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Nor did you nothing hear?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: No, nothing but ourselves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, look you there! look, how it steals away!
My father, in his habit as he lived!
Look, where he goes, even now, out at the portal!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: This the very coinage of your brain:
This bodiless creation ecstasy
Is very cunning in.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ecstasy!
My pulse, as yours, doth temperately keep time,
And makes as healthful music: it is not madness
That I have utter'd: bring me to the test,
And I the matter will re-word; which madness
Would gambol from. Mother, for love of grace,
Lay not that mattering unction to your soul,
That not your trespass, but my madness speaks:
It will but skin and film the ulcerous place,
Whilst rank corruption, mining all within,
Infects unseen. Confess yourself to heaven;
Repent what's past; avoid what is to come;
And do not spread the compost on the weeds,
To make them ranker. Forgive me this my virtue;
For in the fatness of these pursy times
Virtue itself of vice must pardon beg,
Yea, curb and woo for leave to do him good.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: O Hamlet, thou hast cleft my heart in twain.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: O, throw away the worser part of it,
And live the purer with the other half.
Good night: but go not to mine uncle's bed;
Assume a virtue, if you have it not.
That monster, custom, who all sense doth eat,
Of habits devil, is angel yet in this,
That to the use of actions fair and good
He likewise gives a frock or livery,
That aptly is put on. Refrain to-night,
And that shall lend a kind of easiness
To the next abstinence: the next more easy;
For use almost can change the stamp of nature,
And either ... the devil, or throw him out
With wondrous potency. Once more, good night:
And when you are desirous to be bless'd,
I'll blessing beg of you. For this same lord,
I do repent: but heaven hath pleased it so,
To punish me with this and this with me,
That I must be their scourge and minister.
I will bestow him, and will answer well
The death I gave him. So, again, good night.
I must be cruel, only to be kind:
Thus bad begins and worse remains behind.
One word more, good lady.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: What shall I do?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Not this, by no means, that I bid you do:
Let the bloat king tempt you again to bed;
Pinch wanton on your cheek; call you his mouse;
And let him, for a pair of reechy kisses,
Or paddling in your neck with his damn'd fingers,
Make you to ravel all this matter out,
That I essentially am not in madness,
But mad in craft. 'Twere good you let him know;
For who, that's but a queen, fair, sober, wise,
Would from a paddock, from a bat, a gib,
Such dear concernings hide? who would do so?
No, in despite of sense and secrecy,
Unpeg the basket on the house's top.
Let the birds fly, and, like the famous ape,
To try conclusions, in the basket creep,
And break your own neck down.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Be thou assured, if words be made of breath,
And breath of life, I have no life to breathe
What thou hast said to me.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I must to England; you know that?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Alack,
I had forgot: 'tis so concluded on.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: There's letters seal'd: and my two schoolfellows,
Whom I will trust as I will adders fang'd,
They bear the mandate; they must sweep my way,
And marshal me to knavery. Let it work;
For 'tis the sport to have the engineer
Hoist with his own petard: and 't shall go hard
But I will delve one yard below their mines,
And blow them at the moon: O, 'tis most sweet,
When in one line two crafts directly meet.
This man shall set me packing:
I'll lug the guts into the neighbour room.
Mother, good night. Indeed this counsellor
Is now most still, most secret and most grave,
Who was in life a foolish prating knave.
Come, sir, to draw toward an end with you.
Good night, mother.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Exeunt severally; HAMLET dragging in POLONIUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, ROSENCRANTZ, and GUILDENSTERN

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: There's matter in these sighs, these profound heaves:
You must translate: 'tis fit we understand them.
Where is your son?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Bestow this place on us a little while.
Ah, my good lord, what have I seen to-night!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: What, Gertrude? How does Hamlet?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend
Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit,
Behind the arras hearing something stir,
Whips out his rapier, cries, 'A rat, a rat!'
And, in this brainish apprehension, kills
The unseen good old man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: O heavy deed!
It had been so with us, had we been there:
His liberty is full of threats to all;
To you yourself, to us, to every one.
Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd?
It will be laid to us, whose providence
Should have kept short, restrain'd and out of haunt,
This mad young man: but so much was our love,
We would not understand what was most fit;
But, like the owner of a foul disease,
To keep it from divulging, let it feed
Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: To draw apart the body he hath kill'd:
O'er whom his very madness, like some ore
Among a mineral of metals base,
Shows itself pure; he weeps for what is done.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: O Gertrude, come away!
The sun no sooner shall the mountains touch,
But we will ship him hence: and this vile deed
We must, with all our majesty and skill,
Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!
Friends both, go join you with some further aid:
Hamlet in madness hath Polonius slain,
And from his mother's closet hath he dragg'd him:
Go seek him out; speak fair, and bring the body
Into the chapel. I pray you, haste in this.
Come, Gertrude, we'll call up our wisest friends;
And let them know, both what we mean to do,
And what's untimely done...
Whose whisper o'er the world's diameter,
As level as the cannon to his blank,
Transports his poison'd shot, may miss our name,
And hit the woundless air. O, come away!
My soul is full of discord and dismay.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Another room in the castle.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Safely stowed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: Within Hamlet! Lord Hamlet!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: What noise? who calls on Hamlet?
O, here they come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: What have you done, my lord, with the dead body?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Compounded it with dust, whereto 'tis kin.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Tell us where 'tis, that we may take it thence
And bear it to the chapel.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Do not believe it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Believe what?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: That I can keep your counsel and not mine own.
Besides, to be demanded of a sponge! what
replication should be made by the son of a king?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Take you me for a sponge, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, sir, that soaks up the king's countenance, his
rewards, his authorities. But such officers do the
king best service in the end: he keeps them, like
an ape, in the corner of his jaw; first mouthed, to
be last swallowed: when he needs what you have
gleaned, it is but squeezing you, and, sponge, you
shall be dry again.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: I understand you not, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I am glad of it: a knavish speech sleeps in a
foolish ear.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, you must tell us where the body is, and go
with us to the king.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: The body is with the king, but the king is not with
the body. The king is a thing--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: GUILDENSTERN
SPEECH.LINE: A thing, my lord!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Of nothing: bring me to him. Hide fox, and all after.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. Another room in the castle.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I have sent to seek him, and to find the body.
How dangerous is it that this man goes loose!
Yet must not we put the strong law on him:
He's loved of the distracted multitude,
Who like not in their judgment, but their eyes;
And where tis so, the offender's scourge is weigh'd,
But never the offence. To bear all smooth and even,
This sudden sending him away must seem
Deliberate pause: diseases desperate grown
By desperate appliance are relieved,
Or not at all.
How now! what hath befall'n?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Where the dead body is bestow'd, my lord,
We cannot get from him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: But where is he?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Without, my lord; guarded, to know your pleasure.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Bring him before us.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Ho, Guildenstern! bring in my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Now, Hamlet, where's Polonius?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: At supper.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: At supper! where?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Not where he eats, but where he is eaten: a certain
convocation of politic worms are e'en at him. Your
worm is your only emperor for diet: we fat all
creatures else to fat us, and we fat ourselves for
maggots: your fat king and your lean beggar is but
variable service, two dishes, but to one table:
that's the end.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, alas!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: A man may fish with the worm that hath eat of a
king, and cat of the fish that hath fed of that worm.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: What dost you mean by this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Nothing but to show you how a king may go a
progress through the guts of a beggar.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Where is Polonius?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: In heaven; send hither to see: if your messenger
find him not there, seek him i' the other place
yourself. But indeed, if you find him not within
this month, you shall nose him as you go up the
stairs into the lobby.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Go seek him there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: He will stay till ye come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Hamlet, this deed, for thine especial safety,--
Which we do tender, as we dearly grieve
For that which thou hast done,--must send thee hence
With fiery quickness: therefore prepare thyself;
The bark is ready, and the wind at help,
The associates tend, and every thing is bent
For England.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: For England!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, Hamlet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Good.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: So is it, if thou knew'st our purposes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I see a cherub that sees them. But, come; for
England! Farewell, dear mother.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Thy loving father, Hamlet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: My mother: father and mother is man and wife; man
and wife is one flesh; and so, my mother. Come, for England!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Follow him at foot; tempt him with speed aboard;
Delay it not; I'll have him hence to-night:
Away! for every thing is seal'd and done
That else leans on the affair: pray you, make haste.
And, England, if my love thou hold'st at aught--
As my great power thereof may give thee sense,
Since yet thy cicatrice looks raw and red
After the Danish sword, and thy free awe
Pays homage to us--thou mayst not coldly set
Our sovereign process; which imports at full,
By letters congruing to that effect,
The present death of Hamlet. Do it, England;
For like the hectic in my blood he rages,
And thou must cure me: till I know 'tis done,
Howe'er my haps, my joys were ne'er begun.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. A plain in Denmark.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter FORTINBRAS, a Captain, and Soldiers, marching

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Go, captain, from me greet the Danish king;
Tell him that, by his licence, Fortinbras
Craves the conveyance of a promised march
Over his kingdom. You know the rendezvous.
If that his majesty would aught with us,
We shall express our duty in his eye;
And let him know so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: I will do't, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
SPEECH.LINE: Go softly on.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter HAMLET, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Good sir, whose powers are these?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: They are of Norway, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How purposed, sir, I pray you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: Against some part of Poland.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Who commands them, sir?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: The nephews to old Norway, Fortinbras.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Goes it against the main of Poland, sir,
Or for some frontier?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: Truly to speak, and with no addition,
We go to gain a little patch of ground
That hath in it no profit but the name.
To pay five ducats, five, I would not farm it;
Nor will it yield to Norway or the Pole
A ranker rate, should it be sold in fee.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, then the Polack never will defend it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: Yes, it is already garrison'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Two thousand souls and twenty thousand ducats
Will not debate the question of this straw:
This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace,
That inward breaks, and shows no cause without
Why the man dies. I humbly thank you, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Captain
SPEECH.LINE: God be wi' you, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: ROSENCRANTZ
SPEECH.LINE: Wilt please you go, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I'll be with you straight go a little before.
How all occasions do inform against me,
And spur my dull revenge! What is a man,
If his chief good and market of his time
Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.
Sure, he that made us with such large discourse,
Looking before and after, gave us not
That capability and god-like reason
To fust in us unused. Now, whether it be
Bestial oblivion, or some craven scruple
Of thinking too precisely on the event,
A thought which, quarter'd, hath but one part wisdom
And ever three parts coward, I do not know
Why yet I live to say 'This thing's to do;'
Sith I have cause and will and strength and means
To do't. Examples gross as earth exhort me:
Witness this army of such mass and charge
Led by a delicate and tender prince,
Whose spirit with divine ambition puff'd
Makes mouths at the invisible event,
Exposing what is mortal and unsure
To all that fortune, death and danger dare,
Even for an egg-shell. Rightly to be great
Is not to stir without great argument,
But greatly to find quarrel in a straw
When honour's at the stake. How stand I then,
That have a father kill'd, a mother stain'd,
Excitements of my reason and my blood,
And let all sleep? while, to my shame, I see
The imminent death of twenty thousand men,
That, for a fantasy and trick of fame,
Go to their graves like beds, fight for a plot
Whereon the numbers cannot try the cause,
Which is not tomb enough and continent
To hide the slain? O, from this time forth,
My thoughts be bloody, or be nothing worth!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Elsinore. A room in the castle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter QUEEN GERTRUDE, HORATIO, and a Gentleman

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: I will not speak with her.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Gentleman
SPEECH.LINE: She is importunate, indeed distract:
Her mood will needs be pitied.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: What would she have?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Gentleman
SPEECH.LINE: She speaks much of her father; says she hears
There's tricks i' the world; and hems, and beats her heart;
Spurns enviously at straws; speaks things in doubt,
That carry but half sense: her speech is nothing,
Yet the unshaped use of it doth move
The hearers to collection; they aim at it,
And botch the words up fit to their own thoughts;
Which, as her winks, and nods, and gestures
yield them,
Indeed would make one think there might be thought,
Though nothing sure, yet much unhappily.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twere good she were spoken with; for she may strew
Dangerous conjectures in ill-breeding minds.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Let her come in.
To my sick soul, as sin's true nature is,
Each toy seems prologue to some great amiss:
So full of artless jealousy is guilt,
It spills itself in fearing to be spilt.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Where is the beauteous majesty of Denmark?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: How now, Ophelia!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: How should I your true love know
From another one?
By his cockle hat and staff,
And his sandal shoon.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, sweet lady, what imports this song?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Say you? nay, pray you, mark.
He is dead and gone, lady,
He is dead and gone;
At his head a grass-green turf,
At his heels a stone.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but, Ophelia,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Pray you, mark.
White his shroud as the mountain snow,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, look here, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Larded with sweet flowers
Which bewept to the grave did go
With true-love showers.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: How do you, pretty lady?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Well, God 'ild you! They say the owl was a baker's
daughter. Lord, we know what we are, but know not
what we may be. God be at your table!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Conceit upon her father.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Pray you, let's have no words of this; but when they
ask you what it means, say you this:
To-morrow is Saint Valentine's day,
All in the morning betime,
And I a maid at your window,
To be your Valentine.
Then up he rose, and donn'd his clothes,
And dupp'd the chamber-door;
Let in the maid, that out a maid
Never departed more.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Pretty Ophelia!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: Indeed, la, without an oath, I'll make an end on't:
By Gis and by Saint Charity,
Alack, and fie for shame!
Young men will do't, if they come to't;
By cock, they are to blame.
Quoth she, before you tumbled me,
You promised me to wed.
So would I ha' done, by yonder sun,
An thou hadst not come to my bed.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: How long hath she been thus?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: I hope all will be well. We must be patient: but I
cannot choose but weep, to think they should lay him
i' the cold ground. My brother shall know of it:
and so I thank you for your good counsel. Come, my
coach! Good night, ladies; good night, sweet ladies;
good night, good night.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Follow her close; give her good watch,
I pray you.
O, this is the poison of deep grief; it springs
All from her father's death. O Gertrude, Gertrude,
When sorrows come, they come not single spies
But in battalions. First, her father slain:
Next, your son gone; and he most violent author
Of his own just remove: the people muddied,
Thick and unwholesome in their thoughts and whispers,
For good Polonius' death; and we have done but greenly,
In hugger-mugger to inter him: poor Ophelia
Divided from herself and her fair judgment,
Without the which we are pictures, or mere beasts:
Last, and as much containing as all these,
Her brother is in secret come from France;
Feeds on his wonder, keeps himself in clouds,
And wants not buzzers to infect his ear
With pestilent speeches of his father's death;
Wherein necessity, of matter beggar'd,
Will nothing stick our person to arraign
In ear and ear. O my dear Gertrude, this,
Like to a murdering-piece, in many places
Gives me superfluous death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Alack, what noise is this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Where are my Switzers? Let them guard the door.
What is the matter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Gentleman
SPEECH.LINE: Save yourself, my lord:
The ocean, overpeering of his list,
Eats not the flats with more impetuous haste
Than young Laertes, in a riotous head,
O'erbears your officers. The rabble call him lord;
And, as the world were now but to begin,
Antiquity forgot, custom not known,
The ratifiers and props of every word,
They cry 'Choose we: Laertes shall be king:'
Caps, hands, and tongues, applaud it to the clouds:
'Laertes shall be king, Laertes king!'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: How cheerfully on the false trail they cry!
O, this is counter, you false Danish dogs!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: The doors are broke.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Where is this king? Sirs, stand you all without.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Danes
SPEECH.LINE: No, let's come in.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you, give me leave.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Danes
SPEECH.LINE: We will, we will.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: I thank you: keep the door. O thou vile king,
Give me my father!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Calmly, good Laertes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: That drop of blood that's calm proclaims me bastard,
Cries cuckold to my father, brands the harlot
Even here, between the chaste unsmirched brow
Of my true mother.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: What is the cause, Laertes,
That thy rebellion looks so giant-like?
Let him go, Gertrude; do not fear our person:
There's such divinity doth hedge a king,
That treason can but peep to what it would,
Acts little of his will. Tell me, Laertes,
Why thou art thus incensed. Let him go, Gertrude.
Speak, man.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Where is my father?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: But not by him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Let him demand his fill.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: How came he dead? I'll not be juggled with:
To hell, allegiance! vows, to the blackest devil!
Conscience and grace, to the profoundest pit!
I dare damnation. To this point I stand,
That both the worlds I give to negligence,
Let come what comes; only I'll be revenged
Most thoroughly for my father.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Who shall stay you?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: My will, not all the world:
And for my means, I'll husband them so well,
They shall go far with little.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Good Laertes,
If you desire to know the certainty
Of your dear father's death, is't writ in your revenge,
That, swoopstake, you will draw both friend and foe,
Winner and loser?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: None but his enemies.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Will you know them then?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: To his good friends thus wide I'll ope my arms;
And like the kind life-rendering pelican,
Repast them with my blood.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Why, now you speak
Like a good child and a true gentleman.
That I am guiltless of your father's death,
And am most sensible in grief for it,
It shall as level to your judgment pierce
As day does to your eye.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Danes
SPEECH.LINE: Within Let her come in.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: How now! what noise is that?
O heat, dry up my brains! tears seven times salt,
Burn out the sense and virtue of mine eye!
By heaven, thy madness shall be paid by weight,
Till our scale turn the beam. O rose of May!
Dear maid, kind sister, sweet Ophelia!
O heavens! is't possible, a young maid's wits
Should be as moral as an old man's life?
Nature is fine in love, and where 'tis fine,
It sends some precious instance of itself
After the thing it loves.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: They bore him barefaced on the bier;
Hey non nonny, nonny, hey nonny;
And in his grave rain'd many a tear:--
Fare you well, my dove!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Hadst thou thy wits, and didst persuade revenge,
It could not move thus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: You must sing a-down a-down,
An you call him a-down-a.
O, how the wheel becomes it! It is the false
steward, that stole his master's daughter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: This nothing's more than matter.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: There's rosemary, that's for remembrance; pray,
love, remember: and there is pansies. that's for thoughts.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: A document in madness, thoughts and remembrance fitted.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: There's fennel for you, and columbines: there's rue
for you; and here's some for me: we may call it
herb-grace o' Sundays: O you must wear your rue with
a difference. There's a daisy: I would give you
some violets, but they withered all when my father
died: they say he made a good end,--
For bonny sweet Robin is all my joy.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Thought and affliction, passion, hell itself,
She turns to favour and to prettiness.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OPHELIA
SPEECH.LINE: And will he not come again?
And will he not come again?
No, no, he is dead:
Go to thy death-bed:
He never will come again.
His beard was as white as snow,
All flaxen was his poll:
He is gone, he is gone,
And we cast away moan:
God ha' mercy on his soul!
And of all Christian souls, I pray God. God be wi' ye.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Do you see this, O God?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Laertes, I must commune with your grief,
Or you deny me right. Go but apart,
Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will.
And they shall hear and judge 'twixt you and me:
If by direct or by collateral hand
They find us touch'd, we will our kingdom give,
Our crown, our life, and all that we can ours,
To you in satisfaction; but if not,
Be you content to lend your patience to us,
And we shall jointly labour with your soul
To give it due content.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Let this be so;
His means of death, his obscure funeral--
No trophy, sword, nor hatchment o'er his bones,
No noble rite nor formal ostentation--
Cry to be heard, as 'twere from heaven to earth,
That I must call't in question.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: So you shall;
And where the offence is let the great axe fall.
I pray you, go with me.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Another room in the castle.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: What are they that would speak with me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Servant
SPEECH.LINE: Sailors, sir: they say they have letters for you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Let them come in.
I do not know from what part of the world
I should be greeted, if not from Lord Hamlet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Sailor
SPEECH.LINE: God bless you, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Let him bless thee too.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Sailor
SPEECH.LINE: He shall, sir, an't please him. There's a letter for
you, sir; it comes from the ambassador that was
bound for England; if your name be Horatio, as I am
let to know it is.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Reads 'Horatio, when thou shalt have overlooked
this, give these fellows some means to the king:
they have letters for him. Ere we were two days old
at sea, a pirate of very warlike appointment gave us
chase. Finding ourselves too slow of sail, we put on
a compelled valour, and in the grapple I boarded
them: on the instant they got clear of our ship; so
I alone became their prisoner. They have dealt with
me like thieves of mercy: but they knew what they
did; I am to do a good turn for them. Let the king
have the letters I have sent; and repair thou to me
with as much speed as thou wouldst fly death. I
have words to speak in thine ear will make thee
dumb; yet are they much too light for the bore of
the matter. These good fellows will bring thee
where I am. Rosencrantz and Guildenstern hold their
course for England: of them I have much to tell
thee. Farewell.
'He that thou knowest thine, HAMLET.'
Come, I will make you way for these your letters;
And do't the speedier, that you may direct me
To him from whom you brought them.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. Another room in the castle.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,
And you must put me in your heart for friend,
Sith you have heard, and with a knowing ear,
That he which hath your noble father slain
Pursued my life.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: It well appears: but tell me
Why you proceeded not against these feats,
So crimeful and so capital in nature,
As by your safety, wisdom, all things else,
You mainly were stirr'd up.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: O, for two special reasons;
Which may to you, perhaps, seem much unsinew'd,
But yet to me they are strong. The queen his mother
Lives almost by his looks; and for myself--
My virtue or my plague, be it either which--
She's so conjunctive to my life and soul,
That, as the star moves not but in his sphere,
I could not but by her. The other motive,
Why to a public count I might not go,
Is the great love the general gender bear him;
Who, dipping all his faults in their affection,
Would, like the spring that turneth wood to stone,
Convert his gyves to graces; so that my arrows,
Too slightly timber'd for so loud a wind,
Would have reverted to my bow again,
And not where I had aim'd them.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: And so have I a noble father lost;
A sister driven into desperate terms,
Whose worth, if praises may go back again,
Stood challenger on mount of all the age
For her perfections: but my revenge will come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Break not your sleeps for that: you must not think
That we are made of stuff so flat and dull
That we can let our beard be shook with danger
And think it pastime. You shortly shall hear more:
I loved your father, and we love ourself;
And that, I hope, will teach you to imagine--
How now! what news?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Letters, my lord, from Hamlet:
This to your majesty; this to the queen.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: From Hamlet! who brought them?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Messenger
SPEECH.LINE: Sailors, my lord, they say; I saw them not:
They were given me by Claudio; he received them
Of him that brought them.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Laertes, you shall hear them. Leave us.
'High and mighty, You shall know I am set naked on
your kingdom. To-morrow shall I beg leave to see
your kingly eyes: when I shall, first asking your
pardon thereunto, recount the occasion of my sudden
and more strange return. 'HAMLET.'
What should this mean? Are all the rest come back?
Or is it some abuse, and no such thing?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Know you the hand?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis Hamlets character. 'Naked!
And in a postscript here, he says 'alone.'
Can you advise me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: I'm lost in it, my lord. But let him come;
It warms the very sickness in my heart,
That I shall live and tell him to his teeth,
'Thus didest thou.'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: If it be so, Laertes--
As how should it be so? how otherwise?--
Will you be ruled by me?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, my lord;
So you will not o'errule me to a peace.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: To thine own peace. If he be now return'd,
As checking at his voyage, and that he means
No more to undertake it, I will work him
To an exploit, now ripe in my device,
Under the which he shall not choose but fall:
And for his death no wind of blame shall breathe,
But even his mother shall uncharge the practise
And call it accident.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: My lord, I will be ruled;
The rather, if you could devise it so
That I might be the organ.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: It falls right.
You have been talk'd of since your travel much,
And that in Hamlet's hearing, for a quality
Wherein, they say, you shine: your sum of parts
Did not together pluck such envy from him
As did that one, and that, in my regard,
Of the unworthiest siege.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: What part is that, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: A very riband in the cap of youth,
Yet needful too; for youth no less becomes
The light and careless livery that it wears
Than settled age his sables and his weeds,
Importing health and graveness. Two months since,
Here was a gentleman of Normandy:--
I've seen myself, and served against, the French,
And they can well on horseback: but this gallant
Had witchcraft in't; he grew unto his seat;
And to such wondrous doing brought his horse,
As he had been incorpsed and demi-natured
With the brave beast: so far he topp'd my thought,
That I, in forgery of shapes and tricks,
Come short of what he did.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: A Norman was't?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: A Norman.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Upon my life, Lamond.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: The very same.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: I know him well: he is the brooch indeed
And gem of all the nation.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: He made confession of you,
And gave you such a masterly report
For art and exercise in your defence
And for your rapier most especially,
That he cried out, 'twould be a sight indeed,
If one could match you: the scrimers of their nation,
He swore, had had neither motion, guard, nor eye,
If you opposed them. Sir, this report of his
Did Hamlet so envenom with his envy
That he could nothing do but wish and beg
Your sudden coming o'er, to play with him.
Now, out of this,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: What out of this, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Laertes, was your father dear to you?
Or are you like the painting of a sorrow,
A face without a heart?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Why ask you this?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Not that I think you did not love your father;
But that I know love is begun by time;
And that I see, in passages of proof,
Time qualifies the spark and fire of it.
There lives within the very flame of love
A kind of wick or snuff that will abate it;
And nothing is at a like goodness still;
For goodness, growing to a plurisy,
Dies in his own too much: that we would do
We should do when we would; for this 'would' changes
And hath abatements and delays as many
As there are tongues, are hands, are accidents;
And then this 'should' is like a spendthrift sigh,
That hurts by easing. But, to the quick o' the ulcer:--
Hamlet comes back: what would you undertake,
To show yourself your father's son in deed
More than in words?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: To cut his throat i' the church.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: No place, indeed, should murder sanctuarize;
Revenge should have no bounds. But, good Laertes,
Will you do this, keep close within your chamber.
Hamlet return'd shall know you are come home:
We'll put on those shall praise your excellence
And set a double varnish on the fame
The Frenchman gave you, bring you in fine together
And wager on your heads: he, being remiss,
Most generous and free from all contriving,
Will not peruse the foils; so that, with ease,
Or with a little shuffling, you may choose
A sword unbated, and in a pass of practise
Requite him for your father.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: I will do't:
And, for that purpose, I'll anoint my sword.
I bought an unction of a mountebank,
So mortal that, but dip a knife in it,
Where it draws blood no cataplasm so rare,
Collected from all simples that have virtue
Under the moon, can save the thing from death
That is but scratch'd withal: I'll touch my point
With this contagion, that, if I gall him slightly,
It may be death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Let's further think of this;
Weigh what convenience both of time and means
May fit us to our shape: if this should fail,
And that our drift look through our bad performance,
'Twere better not assay'd: therefore this project
Should have a back or second, that might hold,
If this should blast in proof. Soft! let me see:
We'll make a solemn wager on your cunnings: I ha't.
When in your motion you are hot and dry--
As make your bouts more violent to that end--
And that he calls for drink, I'll have prepared him
A chalice for the nonce, whereon but sipping,
If he by chance escape your venom'd stuck,
Our purpose may hold there.
How now, sweet queen!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: One woe doth tread upon another's heel,
So fast they follow; your sister's drown'd, Laertes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Drown'd! O, where?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: There is a willow grows aslant a brook,
That shows his hoar leaves in the glassy stream;
There with fantastic garlands did she come
Of crow-flowers, nettles, daisies, and long purples
That liberal shepherds give a grosser name,
But our cold maids do dead men's fingers call them:
There, on the pendent boughs her coronet weeds
Clambering to hang, an envious sliver broke;
When down her weedy trophies and herself
Fell in the weeping brook. Her clothes spread wide;
And, mermaid-like, awhile they bore her up:
Which time she chanted snatches of old tunes;
As one incapable of her own distress,
Or like a creature native and indued
Unto that element: but long it could not be
Till that her garments, heavy with their drink,
Pull'd the poor wretch from her melodious lay
To muddy death.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Alas, then, she is drown'd?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Drown'd, drown'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Too much of water hast thou, poor Ophelia,
And therefore I forbid my tears: but yet
It is our trick; nature her custom holds,
Let shame say what it will: when these are gone,
The woman will be out. Adieu, my lord:
I have a speech of fire, that fain would blaze,
But that this folly douts it.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Let's follow, Gertrude:
How much I had to do to calm his rage!
Now fear I this will give it start again;
Therefore let's follow.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. A churchyard.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Is she to be buried in Christian burial that
wilfully seeks her own salvation?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: I tell thee she is: and therefore make her grave
straight: the crowner hath sat on her, and finds it
Christian burial.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: How can that be, unless she drowned herself in her
own defence?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Why, 'tis found so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: It must be 'se offendendo;' it cannot be else. For
here lies the point: if I drown myself wittingly,
it argues an act: and an act hath three branches: it
is, to act, to do, to perform: argal, she drowned
herself wittingly.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, but hear you, goodman delver,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Give me leave. Here lies the water; good: here
stands the man; good; if the man go to this water,
and drown himself, it is, will he, nill he, he
goes,--mark you that; but if the water come to him
and drown him, he drowns not himself: argal, he
that is not guilty of his own death shortens not his own life.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: But is this law?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, marry, is't; crowner's quest law.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Will you ha' the truth on't? If this had not been
a gentlewoman, she should have been buried out o'
Christian burial.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Why, there thou say'st: and the more pity that
great folk should have countenance in this world to
drown or hang themselves, more than their even
Christian. Come, my spade. There is no ancient
gentleman but gardeners, ditchers, and grave-makers:
they hold up Adam's profession.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Was he a gentleman?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: He was the first that ever bore arms.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Why, he had none.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: What, art a heathen? How dost thou understand the
Scripture? The Scripture says 'Adam digged:'
could he dig without arms? I'll put another
question to thee: if thou answerest me not to the
purpose, confess thyself--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Go to.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: What is he that builds stronger than either the
mason, the shipwright, or the carpenter?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: The gallows-maker; for that frame outlives a
thousand tenants.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: I like thy wit well, in good faith: the gallows
does well; but how does it well? it does well to
those that do in: now thou dost ill to say the
gallows is built stronger than the church: argal,
the gallows may do well to thee. To't again, come.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: 'Who builds stronger than a mason, a shipwright, or
a carpenter?'

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, tell me that, and unyoke.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Marry, now I can tell.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: To't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Mass, I cannot tell.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter HAMLET and HORATIO, at a distance

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Cudgel thy brains no more about it, for your dull
ass will not mend his pace with beating; and, when
you are asked this question next, say 'a
grave-maker: 'the houses that he makes last till
doomsday. Go, get thee to Yaughan: fetch me a
stoup of liquor.
In youth, when I did love, did love,
Methought it was very sweet,
To contract, O, the time, for, ah, my behove,
O, methought, there was nothing meet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Has this fellow no feeling of his business, that he
sings at grave-making?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Custom hath made it in him a property of easiness.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis e'en so: the hand of little employment hath
the daintier sense.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: But age, with his stealing steps,
Hath claw'd me in his clutch,
And hath shipped me intil the land,
As if I had never been such.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: That skull had a tongue in it, and could sing once:
how the knave jowls it to the ground, as if it were
Cain's jaw-bone, that did the first murder! It
might be the pate of a politician, which this ass
now o'er-reaches; one that would circumvent God,
might it not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: It might, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Or of a courtier; which could say 'Good morrow,
sweet lord! How dost thou, good lord?' This might
be my lord such-a-one, that praised my lord
such-a-one's horse, when he meant to beg it; might it not?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, e'en so: and now my Lady Worm's; chapless, and
knocked about the mazzard with a sexton's spade:
here's fine revolution, an we had the trick to
see't. Did these bones cost no more the breeding,
but to play at loggats with 'em? mine ache to think on't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: A pick-axe, and a spade, a spade,
For and a shrouding sheet:
O, a pit of clay for to be made
For such a guest is meet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: There's another: why may not that be the skull of a
lawyer? Where be his quiddities now, his quillets,
his cases, his tenures, and his tricks? why does he
suffer this rude knave now to knock him about the
sconce with a dirty shovel, and will not tell him of
his action of battery? Hum! This fellow might be
in's time a great buyer of land, with his statutes,
his recognizances, his fines, his double vouchers,
his recoveries: is this the fine of his fines, and
the recovery of his recoveries, to have his fine
pate full of fine dirt? will his vouchers vouch him
no more of his purchases, and double ones too, than
the length and breadth of a pair of indentures? The
very conveyances of his lands will hardly lie in
this box; and must the inheritor himself have no more, ha?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Not a jot more, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Is not parchment made of sheepskins?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, my lord, and of calf-skins too.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: They are sheep and calves which seek out assurance
in that. I will speak to this fellow. Whose
grave's this, sirrah?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Mine, sir.
O, a pit of clay for to be made
For such a guest is meet.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I think it be thine, indeed; for thou liest in't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: You lie out on't, sir, and therefore it is not
yours: for my part, I do not lie in't, and yet it is mine.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: 'Thou dost lie in't, to be in't and say it is thine:
'tis for the dead, not for the quick; therefore thou liest.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: 'Tis a quick lie, sir; 'twill away gain, from me to
you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: What man dost thou dig it for?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: For no man, sir.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: What woman, then?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: For none, neither.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Who is to be buried in't?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: One that was a woman, sir; but, rest her soul, she's dead.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How absolute the knave is! we must speak by the
card, or equivocation will undo us. By the Lord,
Horatio, these three years I have taken a note of
it; the age is grown so picked that the toe of the
peasant comes so near the heel of the courtier, he
gaffs his kibe. How long hast thou been a
grave-maker?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Of all the days i' the year, I came to't that day
that our last king Hamlet overcame Fortinbras.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How long is that since?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Cannot you tell that? every fool can tell that: it
was the very day that young Hamlet was born; he that
is mad, and sent into England.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, marry, why was he sent into England?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Why, because he was mad: he shall recover his wits
there; or, if he do not, it's no great matter there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twill, a not be seen in him there; there the men
are as mad as he.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How came he mad?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Very strangely, they say.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How strangely?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Faith, e'en with losing his wits.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Upon what ground?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Why, here in Denmark: I have been sexton here, man
and boy, thirty years.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: How long will a man lie i' the earth ere he rot?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: I' faith, if he be not rotten before he die--as we
have many pocky corses now-a-days, that will scarce
hold the laying in--he will last you some eight year
or nine year: a tanner will last you nine year.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why he more than another?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: Why, sir, his hide is so tanned with his trade, that
he will keep out water a great while; and your water
is a sore decayer of your whoreson dead body.
Here's a skull now; this skull has lain in the earth
three and twenty years.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Whose was it?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: A whoreson mad fellow's it was: whose do you think it was?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Nay, I know not.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: A pestilence on him for a mad rogue! a' poured a
flagon of Rhenish on my head once. This same skull,
sir, was Yorick's skull, the king's jester.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: This?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Clown
SPEECH.LINE: E'en that.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Let me see.
Alas, poor Yorick! I knew him, Horatio: a fellow
of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy: he hath
borne me on his back a thousand times; and now, how
abhorred in my imagination it is! my gorge rims at
it. Here hung those lips that I have kissed I know
not how oft. Where be your gibes now? your
gambols? your songs? your flashes of merriment,
that were wont to set the table on a roar? Not one
now, to mock your own grinning? quite chap-fallen?
Now get you to my lady's chamber, and tell her, let
her paint an inch thick, to this favour she must
come; make her laugh at that. Prithee, Horatio, tell
me one thing.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: What's that, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Dost thou think Alexander looked o' this fashion i'
the earth?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: E'en so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: And smelt so? pah!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: E'en so, my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: To what base uses we may return, Horatio! Why may
not imagination trace the noble dust of Alexander,
till he find it stopping a bung-hole?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: 'Twere to consider too curiously, to consider so.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: No, faith, not a jot; but to follow him thither with
modesty enough, and likelihood to lead it: as
thus: Alexander died, Alexander was buried,
Alexander returneth into dust; the dust is earth; of
earth we make loam; and why of that loam, whereto he
was converted, might they not stop a beer-barrel?
Imperious Caesar, dead and turn'd to clay,
Might stop a hole to keep the wind away:
O, that that earth, which kept the world in awe,
Should patch a wall to expel the winter flaw!
But soft! but soft! aside: here comes the king.
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Enter Priest, &c. in procession; the Corpse of OPHELIA, LAERTES and Mourners following; KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, their trains, &c
SPEECH.LINE: The queen, the courtiers: who is this they follow?
And with such maimed rites? This doth betoken
The corse they follow did with desperate hand
Fordo its own life: 'twas of some estate.
Couch we awhile, and mark.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: What ceremony else?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: That is Laertes,
A very noble youth: mark.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: What ceremony else?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Priest
SPEECH.LINE: Her obsequies have been as far enlarged
As we have warrantise: her death was doubtful;
And, but that great command o'ersways the order,
She should in ground unsanctified have lodged
Till the last trumpet: for charitable prayers,
Shards, flints and pebbles should be thrown on her;
Yet here she is allow'd her virgin crants,
Her maiden strewments and the bringing home
Of bell and burial.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Must there no more be done?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: First Priest
SPEECH.LINE: No more be done:
We should profane the service of the dead
To sing a requiem and such rest to her
As to peace-parted souls.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: Lay her i' the earth:
And from her fair and unpolluted flesh
May violets spring! I tell thee, churlish priest,
A ministering angel shall my sister be,
When thou liest howling.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: What, the fair Ophelia!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Sweets to the sweet: farewell!
I hoped thou shouldst have been my Hamlet's wife;
I thought thy bride-bed to have deck'd, sweet maid,
And not have strew'd thy grave.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: O, treble woe
Fall ten times treble on that cursed head,
Whose wicked deed thy most ingenious sense
Deprived thee of! Hold off the earth awhile,
Till I have caught her once more in mine arms:
Now pile your dust upon the quick and dead,
Till of this flat a mountain you have made,
To o'ertop old Pelion, or the skyish head
Of blue Olympus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Advancing What is he whose grief
Bears such an emphasis? whose phrase of sorrow
Conjures the wandering stars, and makes them stand
Like wonder-wounded hearers? This is I,
Hamlet the Dane.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: LAERTES
SPEECH.LINE: The devil take thy soul!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Thou pray'st not well.
I prithee, take thy fingers from my throat;
For, though I am not splenitive and rash,
Yet have I something in me dangerous,
Which let thy wiseness fear: hold off thy hand.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: Pluck them asunder.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: Hamlet, Hamlet!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: All
SPEECH.LINE: Gentlemen,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Good my lord, be quiet.

SCENE.STAGEDIR: The Attendants part them, and they come out of the grave

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why I will fight with him upon this theme
Until my eyelids will no longer wag.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: O my son, what theme?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I loved Ophelia: forty thousand brothers
Could not, with all their quantity of love,
Make up my sum. What wilt thou do for her?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: O, he is mad, Laertes.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: For love of God, forbear him.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: 'Swounds, show me what thou'lt do:
Woo't weep? woo't fight? woo't fast? woo't tear thyself?
Woo't drink up eisel? eat a crocodile?
I'll do't. Dost thou come here to whine?
To outface me with leaping in her grave?
Be buried quick with her, and so will I:
And, if thou prate of mountains, let them throw
Millions of acres on us, till our ground,
Singeing his pate against the burning zone,
Make Ossa like a wart! Nay, an thou'lt mouth,
I'll rant as well as thou.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: QUEEN GERTRUDE
SPEECH.LINE: This is mere madness:
And thus awhile the fit will work on him;
Anon, as patient as the female dove,
When that her golden couplets are disclosed,
His silence will sit drooping.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Hear you, sir;
What is the reason that you use me thus?
I loved you ever: but it is no matter;
Let Hercules himself do what he may,
The cat will mew and dog will have his day.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: KING CLAUDIUS
SPEECH.LINE: I pray you, good Horatio, wait upon him.
Strengthen your patience in our last night's speech;
We'll put the matter to the present push.
Good Gertrude, set some watch over your son.
This grave shall have a living monument:
An hour of quiet shortly shall we see;
Till then, in patience our proceeding be.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: So much for this, sir: now shall you see the other;
You do remember all the circumstance?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Remember it, my lord?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Sir, in my heart there was a kind of fighting,
That would not let me sleep: methought I lay
Worse than the mutines in the bilboes. Rashly,
And praised be rashness for it, let us know,
Our indiscretion sometimes serves us well,
When our deep plots do pall: and that should teach us
There's a divinity that shapes our ends,
Rough-hew them how we will,--

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: That is most certain.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Up from my cabin,
My sea-gown scarf'd about me, in the dark
Groped I to find out them; had my desire.
Finger'd their packet, and in fine withdrew
To mine own room again; making so bold,
My fears forgetting manners, to unseal
Their grand commission; where I found, Horatio,--
O royal knavery!--an exact command,
Larded with many several sorts of reasons
Importing Denmark's health and England's too,
With, ho! such bugs and goblins in my life,
That, on the supervise, no leisure bated,
No, not to stay the grinding of the axe,
My head should be struck off.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Is't possible?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Here's the commission: read it at more leisure.
But wilt thou hear me how I did proceed?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: I beseech you.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Being thus be-netted round with villanies,--
Ere I could make a prologue to my brains,
They had begun the play--I sat me down,
Devised a new commission, wrote it fair:
I once did hold it, as our statists do,
A baseness to write fair and labour'd much
How to forget that learning, but, sir, now
It did me yeoman's service: wilt thou know
The effect of what I wrote?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Ay, good my lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: An earnest conjuration from the king,
As England was his faithful tributary,
As love between them like the palm might flourish,
As peace should stiff her wheaten garland wear
And stand a comma 'tween their amities,
And many such-like 'As'es of great charge,
That, on the view and knowing of these contents,
Without debatement further, more or less,
He should the bearers put to sudden death,
Not shriving-time allow'd.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: How was this seal'd?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, even in that was heaven ordinant.
I had my father's signet in my purse,
Which was the model of that Danish seal;
Folded the writ up in form of the other,
Subscribed it, gave't the impression, placed it safely,
The changeling never known. Now, the next day
Was our sea-fight; and what to this was sequent
Thou know'st already.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: So Guildenstern and Rosencrantz go to't.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Why, man, they did make love to this employment;
They are not near my conscience; their defeat
Does by their own insinuation grow:
'Tis dangerous when the baser nature comes
Between the pass and fell incensed points
Of mighty opposites.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Why, what a king is this!

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: Does it not, think'st thee, stand me now upon--
He that hath kill'd my king and whored my mother,
Popp'd in between the election and my hopes,
Thrown out his angle for my proper life,
And with such cozenage--is't not perfect conscience,
To quit him with this arm? and is't not to be damn'd,
To let this canker of our nature come
In further evil?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: It must be shortly known to him from England
What is the issue of the business there.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: It will be short: the interim is mine;
And a man's life's no more than to say 'One.'
But I am very sorry, good Horatio,
That to Laertes I forgot myself;
For, by the image of my cause, I see
The portraiture of his: I'll court his favours.
But, sure, the bravery of his grief did put me
Into a towering passion.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: Peace! who comes here?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: OSRIC
SPEECH.LINE: Your lordship is right welcome back to Denmark.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
SPEECH.LINE: I humbly thank you, sir. Dost know this water-fly?

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HORATIO
SPEECH.LINE: No, my good lord.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: HAMLET
